title: Where are the features!?
text: I was really looking forward to the new update. I expected features that I'm assuming have been heavily requested such as cycling lights and more customization options when it comes to the music player. Right now the music player can only flash between preset colors. Why can't it smoothly brighten and dim to the music or smoothly switch between colors? Why can it only flash colors? And why can't we customize which colors we want besides the 3 presets? My roommates both have Hue lights, and while I appreciate the brighter light and better greens that come with the Ilumi, the features are sorely limited. I expected more out of this update than torch, circadian rhythm, and Simon says features. Not to mention, the update didn't fix the issue regarding the Ilumi dimming over time until the on switch is hit again in the app. Please flesh out this app! I believe your product has potential, you just need to bring better features.

title: Very well built bulb, but not so great app or general experience
text: I was a Kickstarter supporter of this product. For a $59 MSRP product, I must say that I am nonplussed. As a Kickstarter supporter, I received my 6 A19 bulbs for about half of ilumi's suggested MSRP, but even at that price, I felt that ilumi still had more hardware and software issues than a premium product like this should ever have at its initial market launch. Most embarrassingly for their quality control department, I ordered 6 A19 bulbs, and although I received 6 sealed boxes, only 5 of them actually contained an A19 bulb! To their customer service department's credit, they rush-shipped my 6th replacement bulb very quickly. But all-in-all, I don't feel that--given the bugs and inconsistent behavior of this "smart bulb"--that it is anywhere near worth the $60 MSRP suggested by ilumi. Simply put, I wouldn't buy this product anywhere near its MSRP, given the frustrations I've had using it.

title: App needs work
text: I love the concept of this bulb. The simple Bluetooth connection is why I chose illumi over competitors, but inconsistency in performance is driving my rating. I feel there is work to be done with better background processes. All in all I like product, it's very fun and unique, I just look forward to improvement in the app to really optimize my experience.

title: Just Awful
text:
I write this review mostly to encourage the company to finally release its new app (which was promised last week) or at least provide transparency as to why it's still unavailable after myriad delays.

As previous reviews have indicated, the current app is a clunky, barely-functional mess that unreliably completes its most basic, essential task: turning the lights on and off. 90% of attempts to do so end with only some of the bulbs responding, requiring multiple retries to achieve the desired result. Bulbs regularly lose connection when turned on and off at the switch, prompting a laborious repairing process.

The other "experiences" are somewhat-to-mostly broken. The "Circadian" setting functions correctly until the final hour when it gets mysteriously brighter. The "Rise & Shine" feature ceased to work after a recent firmware update. I've never reliably been able to use the "Music Sync" or "Torch" modes.

It's a start up and probably a very small team, but if they want to compete against the big boys in this space (Philips, LIFX, etc.), they need to try harder.

title: Buggy, but has potential
text:
The developers did a pretty good job of making sure MVP (Minimum Viable Product) features are available and can be used. I've used every feature of the app, and they work together with the bulbs just fine. The only bugs I've found are with connectivity, and that may be Apple's fault for the bulbs being unable to remain connected after the app is not in focus on my phone.

All together, I think they did a *good enough* job at their first pass. Some design improvements and improved connectivity would make this a much better app. Keep it up guys!

title: Gorgeous colors from bulb!!! Unmatched, period!
text:
I purchased two of the second-generation bulbs; one Edison, and one par, and after attempting to download the app on my iPad-even though it's an iPhone only app - I was very discouraged to read that everyone has had so much trouble with the app that I changed my mind and decided to return the bulbs.  Plus, I couldn't get the app to work on my iPad Air 2 at all and it just said a new app is coming.

Suddenly I remembered why I purchased the bulbs in the first place, which was because of the display, and the display didn't have an app.  So for the heck of it, I decided to try the Edison bulb.  I then downloaded the app on my iPhone 6plus.

Yes, the app is extremely rudimentary, but a couple years ago the app would've been considered awesome as hell.  So I decided to be patient.  Immediately the bulb connected to the app. I didn't have to do any sort of search or anything.

The colors of blue are marvelous!!! I can't find any bulb on the market that emits this color of blue!!! 

Then I started using the app to change the colors, and I found yellows and oranges that I've never found on other bulbs on the market either - this includes the Hue bulbs.  

I work in the film industry, and these bulbs are just exquisite, and I can see a vast use for them on film sets. Hear that iLumi?!?  Yes, read my email to ya'll!

The bulb is heavy and well-built, and I'm hoping that it will last a very long time. So if you really like a vast array of colors, you will love this bulb. There's no doubt in my mind. You just have to fiddle around with the app to get the color you want, but you will get the color that you want!  That's what's amazing about this bulb.  I actually matched the bulb color of blue to the color of blue on my wall, and I absolutely couldn't believe it. Color correcting a bulb to match the color on the wall? That's really unheard of.

So before you change your mind about getting this bulb because of the app, try the bulb first. Play with the colors. I haven't tried any other feature on the app, but at this point I don't need to. I'm already crazy about this bulb, and if a new app is ever developed, then that will just be a bonus.

You just have to swipe again to turn them all on again, then hope that when you swipe all off again, they will actually all turn off. title: A bright review
text:
Unlike other reviewers, I have had a nearly flawless experience with the app. I purchased 14 bulbs from ilumi's most recent Kickstarter campaign. They all synced up immediately without difficulty.
    I struggled at first with the interface of the app but quickly found solutions after reading ilumi's FAQ page and doing some quick google searching. For example: initially, whenever I turned my light switch off and back on again some of the bulbs on that circuit would revert back to a different color than what they were just on. I thought this was a problem with the hardware or software, but I found out how to set a "default" color for each bulb. In playing with my settings when I first got my bulbs, I had unknowingly set different defaults for many bulbs. Fixing the default colors fixed my headaches. 
    Pros:
    I use the sunrise feature as an alarm and it works great. 
    Scenes work very well and I can immediately change the mood of my whole house by pushing one preset. 
     I contacted customer service when I increased the number of bulbs on my order, they were extremely fast in replying and very helpful.
     Lights are easily grouped and renaming bulbs makes it easy to maintain specific control.
     Showing them off is fun, I made my whole family jealous.
    Cons:
     Sometimes bulbs can be sluggish to sync when changing multiple bulbs at once.
     Music app is difficult to figure out, I have trouble selecting a specific song to play,and making a playlist is seemingly not possible now. (Although it looks freaking cool when it does work)
     Bulbs do not dim on a dimmer switch. 100% power is needed for their connectivity, they are only dimmable from the app. (Luckily I knew this before I ordered them, otherwise it would have been a big letdown)

Despite these cons I highly recommend the bulbs and this app to control them. I believe a new, updated app is in the works as they mentioned in their Kickstarter campaign.

title: Discontinuing?!
text:
I am awarding 1-star because I don't agree that this first app should be pulled from the App Store. I find it odd that this original ilumi app is being discontinued being that the newer app has major issues with connectivity, stability, UI, and the overall UX. When you look at all of the recent reviews for the newer app, it becomes clear that there's a widespread problem that is not sporadic. This app has had its problems as well, but at least its been generally possible to control the bulbs and set timers most of the time. The new app is completely useless to mostly everyone, but at least this one somewhat works -- not ideal, but somewhat is better than useless. I don't think it's the right time to force people to a completely non-functioning app when this one still works enough for many people to keep using their bulbs in some fashion via an app.

I think it would help if ilumi would start a user beta testing group. Oftentimes it's difficult to identify hardware and/or software problems outside of a company's building without having real world use-cases from which to obtain data, bug reports, general feedback, etc. Perhaps some experienced beta testers, under more realistic conditions (i.e. your customer's homes, offices, etc.), can provide crucial feedback that the team evidently needs to develop the app your ilumi supporters clearly deserve. I personally have 19 years of hardware/software beta experience and would happily volunteer to help test via TestFlight (or a similar iOS beta platform), and I'm sure others would do the same if you were to ask. I backed your most recent campaign for the light strips and happened to inherit the standard bulbs brand new in the boxes from my brother (who backed the first campaign) when he decided to adopt another bulb platform while waiting to receive his ilumi rewards. There are lots of people who believe in this company and want to help, so please consider it everyone's thoughts.

Personally, I think it makes sense to scrap the newer app that's apparently unusable, leave this old app alone for now albeit its limits, and then start working on developing a totally brand new app from scratch. Your hardware is quite nice, but us early adopters are sadly not getting our money's worth with all these app issues. It's such a shame that your app development doesn't seem to be working out. Whatever the issues, please explain the details more clearly via Kickstarter updates and know that we still support you -- but it's getting difficult for many people to stay patient when the product just hasn't been working because of several failed app development attempts (I'm admittedly far too patient, lol). If I can help with beta testing or anything else, please send me a DM on Twitter (@MashaT22) or a private message through Kickstarter.

The app has plenty of options to choose from. So many colors! 

Now as for music sync. Can you please allow us to sync our music from services like Spotify or Pandora? 

I don't have any music saved on my iPhone. It's the only reason I purchased the bulb was for that music beat feature. Please take this into consideration! :)

title: New app!!
text: I really enjoy the bulbs and the the color that they produce.  The current app is inconsistent and buggy.  I have been waiting for the new app but it appears that it will not launch in April as ilumi has been saying.  The build also need  integration with HomeKit, Amazon echo, and smart things.  Once this happens, these bulbs will be amazing.

title: Awesome room to grow.
text: I love my Uluru bulb. I pirchased mine at Best Buy because I wanted to be able to return it but I've had it for a bout a week now and I love it. I can control my light from my phone and set different light colors from the touch of a button it's awesome. But there is some room for improvement. Just like other apps that have alarm features they tend not to work all the time. I got the sunrise effective to work once and it was nice. Also the Maurice feature would be much better if it actually went with the beat instead of going to a preset. That's my biggest complaint. But other than that the app works great.

title: Crashes
text: Well it crashes while in music mode, which is the only way to strobe the lights, which is a bummer. Id like to be able to use Spotify or at least stream music from Apple Music. Please for the love of god make it strobe without attaching to music.

title: Stay Away at all Costs!
text: I recently purchased 14 ilumi bulbs and downloaded this app.  The bulbs turn on and off in other rooms for no apparent reason.  They have NO customer support via phone to speak of.  Only a recorded message apologizing for their problems with this app.  I am returning all products to Best Buy and deleting this app.  I guess I will try Phillips HUE as at least they are a bigger company and due have a relationship with Apple via the Apple Home Kit.  I am very Disgusted and Disappointed with Ilumi.  Beware!!!

title: 1 star cause can't give zero
text: Great light. Horrible app. Please consider letting 3 year olds code your next app. They could not make it any worse. BTW I own 7 of your lamps. Fix them darn app!

title: Great app for the product
text:
Although the app and the lightbulb are great, the price is just simply not right for me. The lightbulbs cost almost $100.00 and i can't afford that kind of light bulb. 
Great idea though.
